description:
You cannot go past this outstanding, modernised unit if you're a single person or couple in the market for a comfortable, secure and beautifully appointed home.
It's a real find for its proximity to the beach and town as well as for its classy styling, and there's nothing to do but move in and enjoy an easy, peaceful lifestyle.
Towards the end of a quiet complex of just eight in prestigious Hare Street, the rendered double brick and Colorbond unit represents savvy buying for those who appreciate their own space and privacy.
As part of extensive renovations, the kitchen, bathroom, toilet, laundry and office have all had a complete, quality makeover, and the place has fresh décor and new floor coverings and LED lights.
The sunny, inviting unit features an open-plan living area comprising a generous lounge and dining space with attractive timber veneer flooring, a smart Nectre wood fire for cosy winters and a picture window looking onto the front. An elegant, decorative ceiling in this room is a delightful nod to the home's 1980s origins.
The impressive kitchen boasts cabinetry and tiled splashbacks in muted sage green set off with sparkling white overhead cupboards, and a bay window over the sink.
For outdoor living and relaxation, there's a private courtyard with garden beds of easy-care succulents and cacti and ample space for barbies and lazy summer brunches.
Both bedrooms are carpeted and have built-in robes. The main one is queen sized and the other is a big single. The nearby shower room sports contemporary tiling and fittings, and the toilet is separate.
A welcome – and useful – inclusion for most owners is the office with a built-in desk and cabinetry, and space for the computer and paperwork.
A separate rendered brick building in the yard has been cleverly converted to a practical laundry sporting tasteful built-in cabinetry as well as a broom cupboard and linen press.
There's a garage with power and lighting under the main roof, and guest parking spots right in front of the unit.
Owners will love the location a short drive from town and within easy reach of Middleton Beach's tourist precinct, coastline, parks, walks and restaurants – it's a lifestyle many would envy.
The unit would be ideal for owner-occupiers or rental investors looking for a low-maintenance, tenant-friendly home with the potential for good returns.
Immaculately presented and in excellent shape throughout, this lovely property is sure to be snapped up. Contact Lee Stonell on 0409 684 653 or lee@merrifield.com.au today to avoid the disappointment of missing out.

What you need to know:
- Rendered double brick and Colorbond unit
- Beautifully modernised, classy finishing
- New kitchen, bathroom, toilet, laundry, office
- In quiet complex of eight units
- Light, open lounge and dining area with wood fire
- Smart kitchen in muted sage green and white
- Queen-sized master bedroom with built-in robe
- Big single bedroom with built-in robe
- Office with fitted desk and cupboards
- Shower room and vanity, separate toilet
- Laundry with fitted cabinetry
- Private courtyard
- Garage with power and lighting
- Guest parking in front of unit
- Close to beach and town
- Stylish living for single person, couple
- Immaculate presentation, well maintained
- Council rates $2,064.20 per annum
- Water rates $1,488.73 per annum
- Strata levy $1,428.00 per annum (includes building insurance)
